tool.name: SMAP
tool.command: ### haplotype sites ## create output dir #set $out_dir=haplotype_sites_output; mkdir $out_dir; #set $out_base=hs_base ## create input dir for bam and bai files mkdir alignments_dir; #set $input_list = [] #for $i, $input in enumerate($input_bams): #set $safename = re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', $input.element_identifier) #if $safename in $input_list: #set $safename = str($safename) + "." + str($i) #end if ln -sf '${input}' 'alignments_dir/${safename}.bam' && ln -sf '${input.metadata.bam_index}' 'alignments_dir/${safename}.bai' && #end for smap haplotype-sites alignments_dir $bed_sites_file $vcf_file -mapping_orientation $mapping_orientation -partial $partial --min_read_count $min_read_count $no_indels --discrete_calls '$discrete_calls' --min_haplotype_frequency $min_haplotype_frequency -p "\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1}" --min_distinct_haplotypes $min_distinct_haplotypes --plot_type png --plot $plot #if $frequency_interval_bounds: --frequency_interval_bounds '$frequency_interval_bounds' #end if #if $dosage_filter: --dosage_filter $dosage_filter #end if -o $out_dir/$out_base ; ## mv main outputs to corresponding file destination mv $out_dir/$out_base_coordinates.tsv $out_base_coordinates; mv $out_dir/$out_base_haplotype_frequencies_c0_f0_m0.tsv $haplotype_frequencies; mv $out_dir/$out_base_read_counts_c0_f0_m0.tsv $read_counts; #if $plot != 'nothing': mv $out_dir/$out_base_haplotype_counts_frequencies.barplot.png $frequencies_barplot; #end if ## when using --plot all there is 1 plot per bam file named **..frequency.histogram.png #if $plot == 'all': ## I should use discover outputs, but can simplify it if I move them first to a specific dir and discover all png from there mkdir frequency_plots; mv $out_dor/*.frequency.histogram.png frequency_plots; #end if

param.label: Should strandedness of read mapping be considered for haplotyping?

param.name: vcf_file
param.label: Variants positions File
param.help: Should be in VCFv4.2 format, containing variant positions. It should contain at least the first 9 columns listing the SNP positions, sample-specific genotype calls across the sampleset are not required. Positional mandatory argument, should be the third argument after smap haplotype-sites.

param.label: Select which plots are to be generated.
param.option: Summary (plots with information for all samples)

param.label: Value to use for non-existing or masked data
Minimum .bam mapping quality to retain reads for analysis
Select true in this option if you want to exclude haplotypes that contain an InDel at the given SNP/SMAP positions.
param.help: These reads are also ignored to evaluate the minimal read count

param.label: Minimal number of distinct haplotypes per locus across all samples
param.help: Loci that do not fit this criterium are removed from the final output

param.label: Maximal number of distinct haplotypes per locus across all samples. Loci that do not fit this criterium are removed from the final output
Minimal total number of reads per locus per sample
Maximal number of reads per locus per sample, read count is calculated after filtering out the low frequency haplotypes
Set minimal HF (in pecentage) to retain the haplotype in the genotyping matrix
param.help: Haplotypes above this threshold in at least one of the samples are retained. Haplotypes that never reach this threshold in any of the samples are removed

param.label: Mask haplotype frequency values below this threshold for individual samples to remove noise from the final output
param.help: Haplotype frequency values below this threshold are set to -u. Haplotypes are not removed based on this value, use --min_haplotype_frequency for this purpose instead.

param.label: Discrete calls
param.help: Select “dominant” to transform haplotype frequency values into presence(1)/absence(0) calls per allele, or dosage to indicate the allele copy number

param.label: Frequency interval bounds for classifying the read frequencies into discrete calls
param.help: Custom thresholds can be defined by passing one or more space-separated integers or floats which represent relative frequencies in percentage. For dominant calling, one value should be specified. For dosage calling, an even total number of four or more thresholds should be specified

param.label: Mask dosage calls in the loci for which the total allele count for a given locus at a given sample differs from the defined value
param.help: For example, in diploid organisms the total allele copy number must be 2, and in tetraploids the total allele copy number must be 4. (default no filtering).

param.label: Threshold value: % of samples with locus correctness.
param.help: Create a new .bed file defining only the loci that were correctly dosage called in at least the defined percentage of samples (default no filtering)
